text: The Romanian ambassador in Tel Aviv is the official representative of the Government in Bucharest to the Government of Israel. == List of Representatives == {| class="wikitable sortable" !| designation !| Diplomatic accreditation !| ambassador !| Observations !| List of Prime Ministers of Romania !| List of Prime Ministers of Israel !| term end |- | | | |(* 1908) Envoy Extraordinary and Minister Plenipotentiary. The Romanian minister in Israel, Nicolae Cioroiu, was recalled to Bucharest in January 1950 following the recall of the Israeli minister from Bucharest (see also Doc. 246, n. 7). 4. Reuven Rubin, Israel's minister to Romania. He had previously been extraordinary and plenipotentiary minister in Rome. From 1950 to 1952 he was Rumanian ambassador to the United Kingdom. From 1952 to 1956 he was Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs after the removal of Ana Pauker. From 1956 to 1957 he was Rumanian ambassador to China and Hanoi. From 1957 to 1961 he was Rumanian ambassador to India. In 1971 he became director of the History Museum of the PCR. In 1974 he was conspicuous for having "unofficial contacts" with diplomats accredited in Bucharest and making "inappropriate remarks" about the party leadership, got in trouble with the Securitate.Nicolae Cioroiu La 13 octombrie 1949, Nicolae Cioroiu, ministrul R.P.R. în Israel, începând din 11 septembrie 194919, a fost primit de primul ministru Ben Gurion, care a afirmat c este ,,îngrijorat de soarta evreilor care voind s vin în Israel nu au permisiunea ....economist i diplomat, licen iat al Academiei de Înalte Studii Comerciale i Industriale din Bucure ti (1932)," |Constantin Ion Parhon |David Ben-Gurion | |- | | |Gheorghe Chitic |Chargé d'affaires |Chivu Stoica |David Ben-Gurion | |- | | |Petre Manu |In 1961 he became Romanian envoy to SwedenPetre Manu |Chivu Stoica |David Ben-Gurion | |- | | | |Valeriu Georgescu |Chivu Stoica |Levi Eshkol | |- | | | |Radio Romania International (December 25) said that Ion Covaci has been appointed ambassador to Israel. In 1960 he was third secretary in Tel Aviv. In 1968 he was ambassador in Central Africa. In 1970 he was ambassador in Rangoon. On he negotiated during the Ma'alot massacre. On he was designated ambassador to Cairo. Ambasadorul României în Israel [Ion Covaci] şi-a prezentat scrisorile de acreditare. Decretul nr. 443/1971 pentru rechemarea tovarășului Valeriu Georgescu din calitatea de ambasador extraordinar și plenipotențiar al Republicii Socialiste România în Israel și acreditarea tovarășului Ioan Covaci în calitatea de ambasador extraordinar și plenipotențiar al Republicii Socialiste România în Israel. 1980 Yitzhak Navon received Romanian Ambassador Ion Covaci who paid his farewall call.Ioan Covaci Ma'alot massacre1960 third secretary Domnul Ion Covaci se recheamă din calitatea de ambasador extraordinar și plenipotențiar al României în Republica Arabă Egipt. |Ion Gheorghe Maurer |Golda Meir | |- | | |Constantin Vasìliu | |Constantin Dăscălescu |Shimon Peres | 10 February 1989 ROMANIA [Text] Tel Aviv AGERPRES, 9/2/l989— Yitzhaq Shamir, prime minister of the state of Israel, received Ion Stoian, secretary of the CC of the RCP, who is in Israel as special envoy of the Romanian head of state. |- | | | |ambasadorului României în Israel, Radu Homescu |Petre Roman |Yitzhak Shamir | |- | | |Mircea Mironenco |Charge d'affaires |Nicolae Văcăroiu |Yitzhak Rabin | |- | | | |In 1973 he was Romanian ambassador to the Central African Republic Domnul Gheorghe Popescu se acreditează în calitatea de ambasador extraordinar şi plenipotenţiar al României în Israel. DECRETUL nr. 220 din 9 iunie 1997 privind acreditarea unui ambasador Publicat în M. Of. nr. 126 din 19 Iunie 1997 înGheorghe Popescu |Victor Ciorbea |Benjamin Netanyahu | |- | | | |Valeria Mariana StoicaMariana Stoica |Mugur Isărescu |Ehud Barak | |- | | |Eduard Iosiper |poezie în prezenţa Excelenţei sale, Ambasadorul României în Israel, Eduard IosiperEduard Iosiper |Călin Popescu-Tăriceanu |Ehud Olmert | |- | | |Andreea Păstarnac |(* September 24, 1967, in Brasov. In 1990 he graduated from the Faculty of Philology, at the University of Bucharest and has studied in the fields of Hebrew Language and Literature and International Relations (Near East) at the Hebrew University of Jerusalem, Israel (1995). He also graduated from the Foreign Affairs Academy, the Diplomatic Academy, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs (1994) and a training course in the field of Middle East issues, Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Israel (2003), according to the mae.ro website. He also has an academic experience, being an assistant professor at the University of Bucharest, Faculty of Foreign Languages, Department of Oriental Languages (1991-1993), guest professor at the University of Tel Aviv - the Romanian language and civilization course (1996-2001) Bucharest, Center for Masters of Hebrew Studies (2001-2005).In the Ministry of Foreign Affairs he held positions: attached to the Department for Relations with Romanians Outside the Borders, Directorate for the Middle East (1993); affiliated with the diaspora at the Embassy of Romania in Tel Aviv (1995-2001); Secretary III and Secretary II of the Near East and Africa Directorate (1997-2001); Deputy Director of the Near East and Africa Directorate (2002); Deputy Director of the Middle East Directorate, Africa, Asia-Pacific (2003); Secretary I (2003); Director of Middle East, Africa, Asia (Febr. 2004); Director of the Middle East and Africa Directorate (2005). He was responsible for the preparation of the candidacy and participation in negotiations for the acceptance of Romania in the Task Force for International Cooperation on Holocaust Education, Remembrance and Research (2001-2005) and responsible for preparing Romania's participation in the Euromediterranean Partnership (2002-2005). , BIOGRAPHY. From 2006 to 2011, he was Ambassador of Romania to Cyprus, and in September 2013 he became Ambassador of Romania to Israel.Andreea Păstârnac victorbostinaru.ro/resurse/RO-Israel.pdf] |Victor Ponta |Benjamin Netanyahu | |- | | |Ovidiu Ierulescu |Chargé d'affaires a.i., Minister PlenipotentiaryOvidiu Ierulescu |Dacian Cioloș |Benjamin Netanyahu | |} Cabinet of Israel, ; Victor Boștinaru, România – Israel 1948 – 1969 diplomatic documents, == References == Israel Romania
title: List of ambassadors of Romania to Israel
